definition: to ignore/to let alone/to indulge
to put/to place/to release/to free/to let go/to let out/to set off (fireworks)
surname Ren/Ren County 任縣|任县[Ren2 Xian4] in Hebei

to assign/to appoint/to take up a post/office/responsibility/to let/to allow/to give free rein to/no matter (how, what etc)/classifier for terms served in office, or for spouses, girlfriends etc (as in 前任男友)
to let sb do whatever they want/to indulge/to give free reins to/to let things slide/to drift aimlessly/laissez-faire
laissez-faire
laissez-faire policy/non-interference

sentences.english: They could ruin your life… if you let them.
sentences.chinese: 如果你放任不管，可能會毀了你的生活。

sentences.english: The realm of reproductive technology is unusually laissez-faire in the U.S.
sentences.chinese: 在美國對待輔助生育技術的濫用持放任自流的態度。

sentences.english: Residents resented the police for abandoning them.
sentences.chinese: 當地的居民因警方對他們放任不管而心生憎恨。

sentences.english: Don't tell Jim how to discipline his children. Leave well enough alone.
sentences.chinese: 不必告訴吉姆怎麼管學孩子，放任自流吧。

sentences.english: He permits his own unconstrained indulgence in poetic enjambment.
sentences.chinese: 他放任自己無限制的使用連結體詩句。

sentences.english: Poet's status also has brought their laissez faire personality.
sentences.chinese: 詩人的身份，又帶來了他們的放任情性。

sentences.english: Are you thinking scrumptious and satisfying? Or unhealthy and extravagant?
sentences.chinese: 是美味的滿足感，還是不健康和放任自己？

sentences.english: I indulge themselves again because wellgain, and the end, I a personnephew coriolano.
sentences.chinese: 我放任了自己一次又一次，結局我一個人舉目無親。

sentences.english: Hong Kong, of course, sets greater store by laissez-faire principles.
sentences.chinese: 當然香港更加重視自由放任的原則。

sentences.english: We have allowed the means by which we live to outdistance the ends for which we live.
sentences.chinese: 我們放任生活的手段凌駕於生活的目的之上。

sentences.english: Modern accounting has followed a developmental path from Laze fare to governmental regulation.
sentences.chinese: 現代會計的發展走過了從自由放任到政府監管的歷程。

sentences.english: The third major element has been the creation of corporatist welfare and the abandonment of laissez faire.
sentences.chinese: 第三個主要因素已建立社團的福利和放棄自由放任。

sentences.english: They gaudio-videoe up their holidays in order to fulfil their work plexcellent.
sentences.chinese: 爲了推行這個勞動計劃，他們放任了假期。

sentences.english: In fact, you might be a bit 'unchained' yourself, in several departments: your thoughts and words, for example.
sentences.chinese: 在一些方面，你有一點自我放任，比如言語，想法。

sentences.english: That doctrine of laissez faire which so often in our history.
sentences.chinese: 在我國曆史上屢見不鮮的自由放任主義原則。

sentences.english: This role for QA reinforced the bad behavior of development that spawned it.
sentences.chinese: 這種質保角色放任了不良的開發行爲。

definition: to let (sb do sth)/to allow/regardless of
to let sb do whatever they want/to indulge/to give free reins to/to let things slide/to drift aimlessly/laissez-faire
see 恣意妄為|恣意妄为[zi4 yi4 wang4 wei2]
to let (sth happen)/to allow (sb to do sth)/to submit to/to yield
to indulge/to connive at
to take a laissez-faire attitude
to put up with/to tolerate
to interfere/to meddle/interference
to pay no heed to (idiom)/to ignore/to brush aside
to run amok (idiom); to commit outrages
to sit and watch, but remain indifferent (idiom)
to accept tacitly/acquiescence
to indulge/to pamper/to connive at/permissive/indulgent/self-indulgent/unrestrained/undisciplined/uncultured/boorish
to behave unscrupulously
not to hear, not to question (idiom)/to show no interest in sth/uncritical/not in the least concerned
to take rash action
